➜ RATIONALE: This teacher resource from Bible scholar John Walton and his wife, Kim, provides helpful background information for teaching the Bible. In a succinct manner, they offer the biblical context, interpretational issues, and mistakes to avoid for numerous Biblical passages.

Resource_Information_Text:
Gladys Aylward: The Little Woman by Gladys Aylward
ISBN/ASIN 978-0802429865 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This engaging missionary biography will inspire students as they read about Gladys Aylward's (1902-1970) willingness to be used by God to serve people in China. Students will also gain an understanding of the cultural and historical context of China during the early 20th century.

God's Smuggler (Young Reader's Edition) by Brother Andrew
ISBN/ASIN 9780800798055 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This young reader's edition depicts Brother Andrew's adventures from a boy in Holland to an adult transporting Bibles during the Cold War into communist countries where it is illegal to be a Christian.

➜ RATIONALE: This missionary biography tells about the life of Mother Teresa (1910-1997) who dedicated her life to God and helping the poor in India.

The Puritan Dilemma: The Story of John Winthrop by Edmund Morgan

➜ RATIONALE: A very readable biography that brings the time period to life.

➜ May sub earlier edition

Knowing God's Truth by Jon Nielson
ISBN/ASIN 978-1433587597 

➜ RATIONALE: In his book Knowing God’s Truth, pastor Jon Nielson gives a clear, meaningful, and practical introduction to systematic theology. This set includes a copy of the book and the companion workbook, covering the basic categories of systematic theology―including Scripture, humanity, sin, the church, and more.

Assignments_T1: The Witch of Blackbird Pond (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Witch of Blackbird Pond by Elizabeth George Speare
ISBN/ASIN 978-0547550299 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: In this Newbery Medal–winning novel, a girl faces prejudice and accusations of witchcraft in seventeenth-century Connecticut. A classic of historical fiction that continues to resonate across the generations.

The Quartet: Orchestrating the Second American Revolution, 1783-1789 by Joseph J. Ellis
ISBN/ASIN 978-0804172486 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This book focuses on four influential men in the era between the Revolution and the formation of the federal government.

Madeleine Takes Command by Ethel Brill
ISBN/ASIN 978-1883937171 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This historical novel, set in 17th century New France, features Madeleine de Vercheres a teenage girl who takes up arms in defense of family, country, and faith against the Iroquois.

Assignments_T2: Madeleine Takes Command (Full Term - Choose this (Canadian focus) OR Johnny Tremain (US focus))
Resource_Information_Text:
Madeleine Takes Command by Ethel Brill
ISBN/ASIN 978-1883937171 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This historical novel, set in 17th century New France, features Madeleine de Vercheres a teenage girl who takes up arms in defense of family, country, and faith against the Iroquois.

✓OPTIONAL 
A Revolution in Color by Jane Kamensky
ISBN/ASIN 978-0393240016 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: For students who want to dive into Copley and his world further, this book gives an interesting picture of the social history of the Revolutionary period. It also helps students to understand the beginning of the art world in America and who Copley was in the greater scheme of things.

Thomas Jefferson's Creme Brulee by Thomas J. Craughwell
ISBN/ASIN 978-1594745782 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: A look at the cultural crossover between nations.

Castle by David Macaulay
ISBN/ASIN 978-0395329207 

➜ RATIONALE: In this Caldecott Honor Book, the author explores the history and construction of castles. As he traces the step-by-step planning and construction of both castle and town, students get a feel for life in the Middle Ages and the architectural knowledge that created these grand structures.

Resource Assignment: 001.004.000*What Adults Don't Know About Architecture->Architecture: Grades 7-8
Assignments_T1: What Adults Don't Know About Architecture (Full Term)
Assignments_T2: What Adults Don't Know About Architecture (Full Term)
Assignments_T3: What Adults Don't Know About Architecture (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
What Adults Don't Know About Architecture by The School of Life
ISBN/ASIN 978-1912891306 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This book is a great introduction to architecture and helps students think about the principles behind design and how architecture affects people and communities.

Colonial Living by Edwin Tunis
ISBN/ASIN 978-0801862274 

➜ RATIONALE: Through detailed descriptions and line drawings, Edward Tunis provides students a glimpse into the past to see the houses, churches, schools, and everyday tools and equipment that were used by the American colonists in the 17th and 18th centuries. This book is also a great resource to inspire entries in your Book of Centuries.

Cathedral by David Macaulay
ISBN/ASIN 978-0544100008 

➜ RATIONALE: Through the use of perspective and dramatic points of view, this book draws readers into the process of building a cathedral. Although it is based on fictional people in a town in Europe, it captures the process of constructing a cathedral and the important features that make up these beautiful churches. This is a color version with new images. 

➜ May sub the black and white version but the text and page numbers vary from the color version.

Cathedrals of the World by John Green
ISBN/ASIN 978-0486283395 

➜ RATIONALE: Even though this is a coloring book, it will be used as a resource to study the different features of cathedrals around the world.

Botticelli by Barbara Deimling
ISBN/ASIN 978-3836542845 

➜ RATIONALE: This essential introduction presents the key works from Botticelli’s collection of paintings to understand the making of a Renaissance legend.



NOTE: OPTIONAL Teacher resource for Grades 1-6.  Assigned readings are included in the lessons for Grades 7-12.

✓OPTIONAL 
Rachel Ruysch: Nature into Art by Schindler, Ebert & Knaap
ISBN/ASIN 978-0878468997 

➜ RATIONALE: This is the only known book resource on Ruysch and was recently released. The images are full pages and beautiful replications.

Holbein by Norbert Wolf
ISBN/ASIN 978-3836563727 

➜ RATIONALE: This book brings together key Holbein paintings to explore his illustrious and international career as well as the courtly drama and radical religious change that informed his work.

NOTE: OPTIONAL Teacher Resource For Grades 1-6.  Assigned readings are included in the lessons for Grades 7-12.

Assignments_T1: The Arts: A Visual Encyclopedia (Full Term)
Assignments_T2: The Arts: A Visual Encyclopedia (Full Term)
Assignments_T3: The Arts: A Visual Encyclopedia (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Arts: A Visual Encyclopedia by DK
ISBN/ASIN 978-1465461780 

➜ RATIONALE: We will be using this as our spine throughout the course. It is a nice overview of global art history. This book was chosen due to its miniscule amount of nudity compared to other art books geared to teens.

✓OPTIONAL 
Children's Book of Art by DK
ISBN/ASIN 978-0744082760 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This is also a nice overview of global art history with some different pieces shown and discussed. It also has close-up sections explaining how to do things in art such as mixing colors or making a fresco, etc. This will be referenced throughout the course for different techniques and extra examples of genres. However, this will be a second resource and all topics will be taught in a way that students can see images online if they do not have the book on hand. This book was chosen due to its minuscule amount of nudity compared to other art books geared to teens.

Assignments_T1: The Beggars' Bible (Choose ONE bio from this list to read over the year)
Assignments_T2: The Beggars' Bible (Continue reading your selected bio or choose a new one.)
Assignments_T3: The Beggars' Bible (Cont. reading selected bio.)
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
The Beggars' Bible by Louise A. Vernon
ISBN/ASIN 978-0836117325 

➜ RATIONALE: This historical fiction book is about John Wycliffe, the famous Oxford professor who translated the Bible into English in the 14th century.  



NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read over the year.

✓OPTIONAL 
The Bible Smuggler by Louise A. Vernon
ISBN/ASIN 978-0836115574 

➜ RATIONALE: This historical fiction book is about William Tyndale, a leading figure in the Reformation, who put himself in harm's way to translate the Bible into English in the early 16th century. 



NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read over the year.

✓OPTIONAL 
Thunderstorm in Church by Louise A. Vernon
ISBN/ASIN 978-0836117400 

➜ RATIONALE: This historical fiction book is about Martin Luther, the 16th-century Protestant Reformer. Through the eyes of Luther's son, students will come to know Martin Luther not only as the great Reformer-preacher, but also as a father with a sense of humor and as a friend.


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read over the year.

Resource Assignment: 001.001.000*The Man Who Laid the Egg->Church History: Grades 1-6
Assignments_T1: The Man Who Laid the Egg
Assignments_T2: The Man Who Laid the Egg
Assignments_T3: The Man Who Laid the Egg
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
The Man Who Laid the Egg by Louise Vernon
ISBN/ASIN 978-0836118285 

➜ RATIONALE: "Erasmus laid the egg that Luther hatched," is what the people said. This historical fiction story tells about the life of Erasmus (1466-1536), a Dutch scholar known for producing a new Latin translation of the New Testament that challenged some of the older interpretations of the previous translation and stirred up some controversy with church leaders. Many of his ideas influenced future Reformers. 


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read over the year.

✓OPTIONAL 
Anselm of Canterbury by Simonetta Carr
ISBN/ASIN 978-1601782410 

➜ RATIONALE: Anselm is probably the greatest theologian who lived during the time between Augustine of Hippo and Thomas Aquinas. His writings have had a great influence on the Christian church, and his teachings about the relation between faith and reason are a vital part of the historical Christian confessions. This biography with wonderful illustrations is written for younger students to come to know this great man of faith. 


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read over the year.

Shared_RollUp_Rotation 1:
Church History: Grades 1-6
Church History: Grades 7-9
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
Cross Among the Tomahawks by Milton Lomask
ISBN/ASIN 978-0983180029 

➜ RATIONALE: A young Huron boy, Tsiko and his friend Satouta meet Father Jean de Brebeuf and begin a journey that will change his life. Set in the mid 1600s, this story paints a vivid picture of the Canadian Jesuit missionaries and their patient work with the peaceful Huron people.


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read. This selection is more accessible for Grades 5-9. Content warning: There is some violence throughout and a graphic description of de Brebeuf's martyrdom at the end of the book.

Shared_RollUp_Rotation 1:
Church History: Grades 1-6
Church History: Grades 7-9
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
Kateri Tekakwitha: Mohawk Maiden by Evelyn Brown
ISBN/ASIN 978-0898703801 

➜ RATIONALE: Tells the story of Kateri Tekakwitha, a Mohawk girl who is kidnapped by the Iroquois. Kateri converts to the Catholic faith through the work of Jesuit missionaries and devotes her life to following Christ. 


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read. This selection is more appropriate for Grades 5-9. Content warning: Some descriptions of violence.

Assignments_T1: Hurlbut's Story of the Bible (Full Term)
Assignments_T2: Hurlbut's Story of the Bible (Full Term)
Assignments_T3: Hurlbut's Story of the Bible (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Hurlbut's Story of the Bible by Jesse Lyman Hurlbut
ISBN/ASIN 978-1-59915-178-6 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: Contains stories from both the Old and New Testaments in a very engaging narrative; omits sections that are unsuitable for younger children. The author adheres to the Bible without embellishment, opinion, or doctrine, making this volume appropriate for any denomination. 

NOTE: The free online option has different page numbers than the lesson plans, but the chapter numbers are the same.

Assignments_T2: Gladys Aylward: The Little Woman (Full Term)
Assignments_T3: Gladys Aylward: The Little Woman (Full Term)
Shared_RollUp_Rotation 4:
Bible Stories
Missionary Biographies: Grade 2
Missionary Biographies: Grades 3-6
Resource_Information_Text:
Gladys Aylward: The Little Woman by Gladys Aylward
ISBN/ASIN 978-0802429865 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This engaging missionary biography will inspire students as they read about Gladys Aylward's (1902-1970) willingness to be used by God to serve people in China. Students will also gain an understanding of the cultural and historical context of China during the early 20th century.

Shared_RollUp_Rotation 4:
Bible Stories
Missionary Biographies: Grade 2
Missionary Biographies: Grades 3-6
Resource_Information_Text:
Teresa of Calcutta by D. Jeanene Watson
ISBN/ASIN 978-0880620123 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This missionary biography tells about the life of Mother Teresa (1910-1997) who dedicated her life to God and helping the poor in India.

Resource Assignment: 001.002.000*Traitor in the Tower: Introducing John Bunyan->Church History: Grades 1-3
Assignments_T1: Traitor in the Tower: Introducing John Bunyan (Full Term)
Assignments_T2: Traitor in the Tower: Introducing John Bunyan (Partial Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Traitor in the Tower: Introducing John Bunyan by Dave & Neta Jackson
ISBN/ASIN 978-1939445247 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This book follows the fictional character of twelve-year-old Richard Winslow, who stays behind in London instead of escaping with the rest of his family to Scotland to help his imprisoned father, only to form a life-changing bond with the historical figure of John Bunyan, a preacher facing execution for his beliefs. Richard must decide whether or not to betray Bunyan to save his father, learning powerful lessons about courage, sacrifice, and faith along the way. Since second and third-graders read Pilgrim's Progress, they might be especially interested to hear about the life of the famous author.

The Chimney Sweep's Ransom by Dave & Neta Jackson
ISBN/ASIN 978-1939445087 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: Using the fictionalized character of a young chimney sweep, this book introduces readers to John Wesley, the great English preacher from the 18th century.  This exciting story focuses on Wesley’s ministry to the coal miners and their families and shows how he lived out his faith through his actions and preaching of God’s love.

➜ RATIONALE: David Brainerd emerged as a compassionate and fearless missionary to the various Native American tribes in America. NOTE: Students will use this book for several years as they read through the OT.

Resource Assignment: 002.001.000*Reform: The Church at the Birth of Protestantism->Church History: Grades 7-9

Resource_Information_Text:
Reform: The Church at the Birth of Protestantism by Luke H. Davis
ISBN/ASIN 978-1527109902 

➜ RATIONALE: This book continues from the previous one in the series that is read in Term 1. Now the events and people of the Reformation are discussed during a time when the church had drifted from the Scriptures. Students will read about Martin Luther, Thomas Cranmer, Lady Jane Grey, and others who risked their lives to stand up for what they believed.

Resource Assignment: 002.002.000*George Whitefield: God's Anointed Servant in the Great Revival of the Eighteenth Century->Church History: Grades 7-9
Assignments_T2: George Whitefield: God's Anointed Servant in the Great Revival of the Eighteenth Century (Full Term)
Assignments_T3: George Whitefield: God's Anointed Servant in the Great Revival of the Eighteenth Century (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
George Whitefield: God's Anointed Servant in the Great Revival of the Eighteenth Century by Arnold A. Dallimore
ISBN/ASIN 978-1433513411 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: God's accomplishments through George Whitefield are to this day virtually unparalleled as his reach through open-air preaching was widespread and led to revival in both the British Isles and America. Dallimore's biography gives an exciting view of Whitefield's work in the context of the 18th century.

Spurgeon: A Biography by Arnold Dallimore
ISBN/ASIN 978-0851514512

Resource Assignment: 003.001.000*The Sword of the Spirit: The Story of William Tyndale->Church History: Grades 7-9
Assignments_T3: The Sword of the Spirit: The Story of William Tyndale (Choose ONE of these biographies to read.)
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
The Sword of the Spirit: The Story of William Tyndale by Joyce McPherson
ISBN/ASIN 978-1882514267 

➜ RATIONALE: If you want to understand the course of the Reformation in England, then the story starts with Tyndale: student, scholar, translator, printer, smuggler, and witness to the truth of the gospel of Jesus Christ. The author's retelling of his life is meticulously researched and engages students' minds and hearts. 


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read.

Resource Assignment: 003.001.000*The River Of Grace: A Story Of John Calvin->Church History: Grades 7-9
Assignments_T3: The River Of Grace: A Story Of John Calvin
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
The River Of Grace: A Story Of John Calvin by Joyce McPherson
ISBN/ASIN 978-1882514540 

➜ RATIONALE: This is a biography of John Calvin, who learned about the Bible and its message of salvation by faith while at university. After his conversion, he became a leader of the Protestants in France until he was driven out by persecution. He spoke and wrote prolifically, carrying on the message of the Reformation, including many commentaries and his "Institutes of the Christian Religion."


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read.

Resource Assignment: 003.001.000*Saint Thomas Aquinas: A Biography for Young Readers->Church History: Grades 7-9
Assignments_T3: Saint Thomas Aquinas: A Biography for Young Readers
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
Saint Thomas Aquinas: A Biography for Young Readers by Mary Ellen Evans, Margaret Nichols, & Geoffrey Gneuhs
ISBN/ASIN 978-1623110192 

➜ RATIONALE: This biography of St Thomas Aquinas covers the highlights of Thomas’s life, from a young son of a wealthy Italian family to a Dominican friar and an influential philosopher and theologian. His writings have had an impact on the Catholic church that remains to this day. This is a great introduction to this Dominican saint and is very readable for students.


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read.

Resource Assignment: 003.001.000*When Lightning Struck!: The Story of Martin Luther->Church History: Grades 7-9
Assignments_T3: When Lightning Struck!: The Story of Martin Luther
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
When Lightning Struck!: The Story of Martin Luther by Danika Cooley
ISBN/ASIN 978-1506405834 

➜ RATIONALE: This historical novel on Martin Luther’s life shows how his questions and desire to learn more about faith led him to read the Bible while a law student. What he learned by reading the Bible, specifically the book of Romans, would change the world. 


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read.

Shared_RollUp_Rotation 1:
Church History: Grades 1-6
Church History: Grades 7-9
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
Cross Among the Tomahawks by Milton Lomask
ISBN/ASIN 978-0983180029 

➜ RATIONALE: A young Huron boy, Tsiko and his friend Satouta meet Father Jean de Brebeuf and begin a journey that will change his life. Set in the mid 1600s, this story paints a vivid picture of the Canadian Jesuit missionaries and their patient work with the peaceful Huron people.


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read. This selection is more accessible for Grades 5-9. Content warning: There is some violence throughout and a graphic description of de Brebeuf's martyrdom at the end of the book.

Shared_RollUp_Rotation 1:
Church History: Grades 1-6
Church History: Grades 7-9
Resource_Information_Text:
✓OPTIONAL 
Kateri Tekakwitha: Mohawk Maiden by Evelyn Brown
ISBN/ASIN 978-0898703801 

➜ RATIONALE: Tells the story of Kateri Tekakwitha, a Mohawk girl who is kidnapped by the Iroquois. Kateri converts to the Catholic faith through the work of Jesuit missionaries and devotes her life to following Christ. 


NOTE: Choose ONE biography (or more) from this list to read. This selection is more appropriate for Grades 5-9. Content warning: Some descriptions of violence.

Transformed by Truth by Katherine Forster
ISBN/ASIN 978-1433564055 

➜ RATIONALE: This book is written for students to encourage them to make Bible reading a special time of their day. The author demonstrates the practices of observation, interpretation, and application so students can discover how God's truth can literally transform them from the inside out. These practices will also be implemented during the NT Bible lessons.

Praying the Bible by Donald Whitney
ISBN/ASIN 978-1433547843 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: The author helps readers with a common struggle that many Christians face—How can I keep my mind from wandering when I pray? He encourages readers to pray the words of the Bible, especially the Psalms. He lays out a plan that can be implemented into students' lives right away.

ISBN/ASIN 978-0310498209 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: It is so important for students to understand the context in which the Bible was written and what it meant to the original audience. However, it is also important to understand how the OT writings are relevant to us today. NOTE: Students will use this book for several years as they read through the OT.

Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: Basic narrative of church history with a historical rather than doctrinal focus. Used with Vidmar's text for a more complete overview of church history.

NOTE: Used for multiple history rotations.

Bullies and Saints by John Dickson
ISBN/ASIN 978-0310119371 

➜ RATIONALE: Bullies and Saints is a sobering and hopeful book that provides a brief overview of the church, especially leading up to and through medieval times.  Dickson is a competent and thought-provoking guide.  The book provides perspective and promotes humility as we wrestle with the actions of those in the church across all ages.


NOTE: Chapter 23 discusses the sensitive topic of child sexual abuse in the modern church.  Alerts will be included in the lesson plans to direct students to their teachers for prereading, guidance, and discussion.

If you prefer to continue with the books read last year, read:  
Church History in Plain Language (T1: p.173-214, T2: p.215-233, T3: 235-290)
The Catholic Church Through the Ages (T1: p.92-171, T2: p.172-212, T3: 212-249)

Resource Assignment: 002.002.000*A Short Life of Jonathan Edwards->Church History: Grades 10-12
Assignments_T2: A Short Life of Jonathan Edwards (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
A Short Life of Jonathan Edwards by George M. Marsden
ISBN/ASIN 978-0802802200 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: Jonathan Edwards is one of the most extraordinary figures in American history. Arguably the most brilliant theologian ever born on American soil, Edwards (1703–1758) was also a pastor, a renowned preacher, a missionary to the Native Americans, a biographer, a college president, a philosopher, a loving husband, and the father of eleven children.

Practicing the Way by John Mark Comer
ISBN/ASIN 978-0593193822 

➜ RATIONALE: This introduction to spiritual formation is full of John Mark Comer’s trademark mix of theological substance and cultural insight as well as practical wisdom on following Jesus.

Friendship with God by Mike McKinley
ISBN/ASIN 978-1433584152 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This book aims to make John Owen’s masterful work Communion with God accessible to a 21st Century audience. Students will be led on an exciting journey that fosters a deeper love for the Triune God of the Bible. The author accomplishes this task by exploring how each member of the Trinity relates to followers of Christ in distinct ways, while still maintaining a unity within the Godhead. The author’s writing style is very accessible and engaging.

God of All Things by Andrew Wilson
ISBN/ASIN 978-0310109082 

➜ RATIONALE: In God of All Things, pastor and author Andrew Wilson invites you to rediscover God through ordinary, everyday things. He explores the idea of a material world and presents a variety of created marvels that reveal the gospel in everyday life and fuel worship and joy in God.

Knowing God's Truth by Jon Nielson
ISBN/ASIN 978-1433587597 

➜ RATIONALE: In his book Knowing God’s Truth, pastor Jon Nielson gives a clear, meaningful, and practical introduction to systematic theology. This set includes a copy of the book and the companion workbook, covering the basic categories of systematic theology―including Scripture, humanity, sin, the church, and more.

How Does Sanctification Work? by David Powlison
ISBN/ASIN 978-1433556104 

➜ RATIONALE: Weaving together personal stories, biblical exposition, and theological reflection, David Powlison highlights the personal and particular means God uses to make us more like Jesus.

ISBN/ASIN 978-1524770945 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

How Canadians Govern Themselves (PDF) ✓PRINT

➜ RATIONALE: Explore Canada’s parliamentary system, from the decisions made by the Fathers of Confederation to the daily work of parliamentarians in the Senate and House of Commons. Useful information on Canada’s Constitution, the judicial system, and provincial and municipal powers is gathered together in this one reference book.

Resource_Information_Text:
Building the Canadian Nation (1953 or 1958 edition) by George Brown
ISBN/ASIN B002O1HIH6 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: Building the Canadian Nation gives students a historic background for our civil liberties and roots our parliamentary process in its British roots.

Resource Assignment: 001.003.000*Parliament: Canada's Democracy and How It Works->Canadian Government: Grade 7
Assignments_T1: Parliament: Canada's Democracy and How It Works (Full Term - p.3-27)
Assignments_T2: Parliament: Canada's Democracy and How It Works (Full Term - p.26-62)
Assignments_T3: Parliament: Canada's Democracy and How It Works (Full Term - p.63-104)
Resource_Information_Text:
Parliament: Canada's Democracy and How It Works by Maureen McTeer
ISBN/ASIN 978-0394224626 

➜ RATIONALE: McTeer provides a friendly insider's view of the life of Parliament. She guides students through the physical spaces, the positions and parties in Parliament, and takes students through the electoral process. Throughout the book she leans on her own experience as a candidate and wife of a prime minister.

Canadian Government: Grade 7
Canadian Gov./ Economics: Grade 8
Resource_Information_Text:

ISBN/ASIN 9780195416299 

➜ RATIONALE: This book explains the electoral process, the different aspects of parliamentary government, the Canadian legal system, and the concept of citizenship.

Resource_Information_Text:
Stewards of Eden: What Scripture Says About the Environment and Why It Matters by Sandra L. Richter
ISBN/ASIN 978-0830849260 

➜ RATIONALE: Richter is a master Bible scholar. Each chapter draws out a biblical mandate about humanity's responsibility to care for the land, domestic and wild creatures, and people on the margins.

The Tech-Wise Family by Andy Crouch 
ISBN/ASIN 978-0801018664 

➜ RATIONALE: Making conscientious choices about technology is more than just using internet filters and determining screen time limits. It's about developing wisdom, character, and courage in the way we use digital media rather than accepting technology's promises of ease, instant gratification, and the world's knowledge at our fingertips. Helpful for students to consider as they head into adulthood.

Resource_Information_Text:
The Plutarch Project Primer: Publicola (Revised) by Anne White
ISBN/ASIN 978-1990258220 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: Students will read about Publicola, one of the first consuls of the Roman Republic. The Plutarch Primer includes vocabulary, discussion questions, and other aids for students and parents/teachers, plus edited text for Plutarch's Life of Publicola. It is designed especially for those who are new to the study of Plutarch. Lesson plans will include additional guidance.

Reading-Literature: The Primer by Free and Treadwell
ISBN/ASIN 978-1599151298 

➜ RATIONALE: This is a great collection of folk tales and poems for a beginning reader. This book series lends itself well to Mason's approach to teaching children to read because of the repetitive pattern of the stories and the decodable text. Use with our Reading Lessons: Level 1.

Reading Lessons: Level 1 (Revised 2025) by Alveary ✓SAVE ✓PRINT
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This program features 15-minute lessons focused on phonics and high-frequency word recognition using classic stories and poems. Includes spelling, copywork, dictation, and some grammar. Lessons are newly revised to reflect recent research, especially the importance of phonological awareness and phonics. The additional instruction is blended into the current lessons from the Free and Treadwell Readers. 

NOTE: Also available in Grade 1 Bundle with Alveary printing store.

Paragraph Town by Michael Clay Thompson
ISBN/ASIN 978-0880926706 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This program brings story, delight, and ideas to the study of grammar. Paragraph Town gives children an entertaining and comprehensive introduction to the paragraph. With a narrative background, students explore the importance of organizing sentences into clear, orderly paragraphs with dialogue, description, comparison, punctuation, and grammar, as well as a look at the significance of the sounds of language. Structured exercises and assignments allow students to practice integrating these ideas into their writing.

ISBN/ASIN 978-0990552963

Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This book explains the many ways in which we can describe where we are located. Beginning in a little girl's room, we gradually zoom out to her house, her street, her town, her state, her country, and her planet.

ISBN/ASIN 978-1952118012 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: Travel from Los Angeles to Washington, D.C. with Tom, Ruth, and their mother and father. As they encounter the different regions of the United States, the children learn about a variety of subjects, including basic geography concepts (landforms, waterbodies, and beginner map skills), as well as about such topics as local economies, climate, and regional plants and animals.

NOTE: Black-and-white version is available on Amazon for $16 ISBN: 978-1952118029.

Grandma Gatewood Hikes the Appalachian Trail by Jennifer Thermes
ISBN/ASIN 978-1419728396 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This longer picture book tells the true story of a 67-year-old grandma who was the first woman to solo hike the Appalachian Trail. It is a great supplement to our geography spine and contains great maps to follow her journey through the trail.

NOTE: Teachers may wish to check this book out from the library rather than purchase it, as it is only used for a couple of lessons.

Marco Polo by Manuel Komroff
ISBN/ASIN 978-1925729528 

➜ RATIONALE: The story of a Venetian trader who becomes an aide to the great Kublai Khan comes to life in this retelling for students. This book will provide the context to explore the geographical features of southern Europe, the Middle East, and East Asia as students follow along with the travels of Marco Polo.

Resource Assignment: 001.004.000*Onward: A Photobiography of African-American Polar Explorer Matthew Henson->Geography: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T1: Onward: A Photobiography of African-American Polar Explorer Matthew Henson (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Onward: A Photobiography of African-American Polar Explorer Matthew Henson by Dolores Johnson
ISBN/ASIN 978-0792279143 
Alternate Formats: Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This informative photobiography tells about Matthew Henson, an African American explorer, who reached the North Pole in 1909 with Robert Peary.

NOTE: If you are subbing with A Negro Explorer at the North Pole, the suggested readings include: Ch.1-6, 10, 13, 15-16, 21
➜ May sub A Negro Explorer at the North Pole (available free or on Amazon)

Resource Assignment: 001.002.000*The Mysterious Voyage of Captain Kidd->Geography: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T1: The Mysterious Voyage of Captain Kidd (Full Term)
Assignments_T2: The Mysterious Voyage of Captain Kidd (Partial Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Mysterious Voyage of Captain Kidd by A.B.C. Whipple
ISBN/ASIN 9781948959551 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This is a biographical story about the late 17th-century Captain William Kidd, who was commissioned as a privateer, only to be accused of piracy. His adventures took him through ports and coasts along the Atlantic and Indian Oceans. By following Captain Kidd on his last mission voyage, students will discover the islands and places that were vital to merchants sailing in the West Indies and the Caribbean.

DISCOUNT: 10% with code Alveary&PHP

Resource Assignment: 002.002.000*The Incredible yet True Adventures of Alexander von Humboldt->Geography: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T2: The Incredible yet True Adventures of Alexander von Humboldt (Partial Term)
Assignments_T3: The Incredible yet True Adventures of Alexander von Humboldt (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Incredible yet True Adventures of Alexander von Humboldt by Volker Mehnert
ISBN/ASIN 978-1615196319 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: A curious and adventurous Alexander von Humboldt dares to travel into unexplored areas of South America and venture north to parts of Mexico, the Caribbean, and the eastern coast of America. Along with his companions, he details the amazing new continent and beyond, rich with geographical landmarks and new biological/ecological discoveries.

Assignments_T2: Bandoola: The Great Elephant Rescue  (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Bandoola: The Great Elephant Rescue  by William Grill
ISBN/ASIN 978-1838740238 

➜ RATIONALE: With wonderful illustrations and interesting text, this book tells how elephants were instrumental in helping refugees leave Burma (Myanmar) and travel to India during WW2. It is a great way to explore the culture and geographical features of these parts of Asia.

Resource Assignment: 003.001.000*The Royal Kingdoms of Ghana, Mali, and Songhay->Geography: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T3: The Royal Kingdoms of Ghana, Mali, and Songhay (selections)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Royal Kingdoms of Ghana, Mali, and Songhay by Patricia McKissack, Fredrick McKissack 
ISBN/ASIN 978-0805042597 

➜ RATIONALE: For more than a thousand years, from A.D. 500 to 1700, the medieval kingdoms of Ghana, Mali, and Songhay grew rich on the gold, salt, and slave trade that stretched across Africa. This book reveals the glory of these forgotten empires while inviting readers to share in the inspiring process of historical recovery that is taking place today.

NOTE: Some sections will be skipped due to time and some sensitive content. Follow page numbers in lesson plans.

Resource Assignment: 003.004.000*Everest: The Remarkable Story of Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay->Geography: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T3: Everest: The Remarkable Story of Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Everest: The Remarkable Story of Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay by Alexandra Stewart
ISBN/ASIN 978-1547601592 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: The fascinating account of the first men to reach the top of Mt. Everest in 1953.

Resource_Information_Text:
Mapping the World with Art by Ellen Johnston McHenry
ISBN/ASIN 978-0982537701 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Video

➜ RATIONALE: This book is a blend of history, geography, and art. The text is about the history of cartography, from the earliest maps that were drawn on clay by the people of Mesopotamia to the exploration of the "new world."  This book also includes map drawing lessons that take students step by step through the process of drawing maps of all the countries mentioned in the text. 

NOTE: We highly recommend purchasing the videos that guide students through the map drawings. The option linked includes a digital version of the book along with the video course, but you can also purchase the videos in DVD or USB format if you prefer a physical copy of the book. Resource Assignment: 001.004.000*Children of the Dust Bowl: The True Story of the School at Weedpatch Camp->Geography: Grades 7-8 (U.S.)
Assignments_T1: Children of the Dust Bowl: The True Story of the School at Weedpatch Camp (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Children of the Dust Bowl: The True Story of the School at Weedpatch Camp by Jerry Stanley
ISBN/ASIN 978-0517880944 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: A true account of the Depression and Dust Bowl era migration from the central plains to southern California and the establishment of the Weedpatch Camp school.

Resource Assignment: 002.004.000*Death on the River of Doubt: Theodore Roosevelt's Amazon Adventure->Geography: Grades 7-8 (U.S.)
Assignments_T2: Death on the River of Doubt: Theodore Roosevelt's Amazon Adventure (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Death on the River of Doubt: Theodore Roosevelt's Amazon Adventure by Samantha Seiple
ISBN/ASIN 978-0545709163 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This book tells the adventurous true story of President Theodore Roosevelt's dangerous journey down one of the most treacherous rivers on Earth. Through the story, students will learn more about the geographical features and the animals and plants that inhabit these parts of Brazil.

Resource Assignment: 003.001.000*Dark Enough to See the Stars in a Jamestown Sky->Geography: Grades 7-8 (U.S.)
Assignments_T3: Dark Enough to See the Stars in a Jamestown Sky
Resource_Information_Text:
Dark Enough to See the Stars in a Jamestown Sky by Connie Lapallo
ISBN/ASIN 978-0983398219 

➜ RATIONALE: This book is based on the true story of a brave woman who sailed to Jamestown in 1609. The author vividly describes the arduous journey, the trials faced by the colonists, and the strained relationship with the Native Americans. She also presents a story of resilience and hope in the midst of hardship and grief. 

NOTE: Click the first link to receive a 15% discount off of the regular price of the book.

Resource Assignment: 003.004.000*The Nature of Yosemite: A Visual Journey->Geography: Grades 7-8 (U.S.)
Assignments_T3: The Nature of Yosemite: A Visual Journey (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Nature of Yosemite: A Visual Journey by Robb Hirsch
ISBN/ASIN 978-1930238923 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This book offers stunning photography and wonderful descriptions of Yosemite that captures the wonder and awe of that great national park.

Resource Assignment: 003.002.000*The Trailblazing Life of Daniel Boone and How Early Americans Took to the Road->Geography: Grade 7 (U.S.)
Assignments_T3: The Trailblazing Life of Daniel Boone and How Early Americans Took to the Road (Full Term)
Shared_RollUp_Rotation 2:
Geography: Grade 7 (U.S.)
Geography: Grade 8 (U.S.)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Trailblazing Life of Daniel Boone and How Early Americans Took to the Road by Cheryl Harness
ISBN/ASIN 978-1426301452 

➜ RATIONALE: A true pioneer and survivalist, Daniel Boone explores early 18th-century North American wilderness and settlements. Along the way, he comes across many adventures and meets interesting people who will help define a new country and certain states. This book has wonderful illustrations, maps, primary-source quotations, and a timeline that runs at the bottom of each page.

The Trailblazing Life of Daniel Boone and How Early Americans Took to the Road by Cheryl Harness
ISBN/ASIN 978-1426301452 

➜ RATIONALE: A true pioneer and survivalist, Daniel Boone explores early 18th-century North American wilderness and settlements. Along the way, he comes across many adventures and meets interesting people who will help define a new country and certain states. This book has wonderful illustrations, maps, primary-source quotations, and a timeline that runs at the bottom of each page.

ISBN/ASIN 979-8878546386 

➜ RATIONALE: After having mapped each of the Canadian provinces and territories - learning their boundaries, capitals, and major landmarks - students will then use this book for a more in-depth exploration of regional geography. Working from map templates, students will proceed to learn about and map the mountains, rivers, and lakes in Canada, and illustrate their maps with drawings of local flora and fauna.

Frances Barkley: Eighteenth-century Seafarer by Cathy Converse
ISBN/ASIN 978-1772034417 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This book is a creative non-fiction account of Frances Barkley's circumnavigation of the globe with her sea-captain husband, based on her written recollection of the journey. The Barkleys were among the first Europeans to encounter the Huu-ay-aht First Nation people, whose traditional lands on the west coast of Vancouver Island were later named Barkley Sound. Frances Barkley also provides a fascinating window into what the close of the 18th century was like in places all over the world, and students will use their atlases to map her journey.

Resource_Information_Text:
The Lost World of the Old Ones by David Roberts
ISBN/ASIN 978-0393352337 

➜ RATIONALE: In this thrilling story of intellectual and archaeological discovery, David Roberts recounts his exploits in search of spectacular prehistoric ruins and rock art panels known to very few modern travelers. His adventures range across Utah, Arizona, New Mexico, and southwestern Colorado, and illuminate the mysteries of the Ancestral Puebloans and their contemporary neighbors the Mogollon and Fremont, as well as of the more recent Navajo and Comanche.


NOTE: Grades 10 & 11 choose Manteo's World OR The Lost World of the Old Ones. Grade 12 reads both.

➜ RATIONALE: In this thrilling story of intellectual and archaeological discovery, David Roberts recounts his exploits in search of spectacular prehistoric ruins and rock art panels known to very few modern travelers. Assignments_T3: Itse Selu: Cherokee Harvest Festival (Partial Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Itse Selu: Cherokee Harvest Festival by Daniel Pennington
ISBN/ASIN 978-0881068504 

➜ RATIONALE: A captivating glimpse of Cherokee life in pre-Columbian North America. Join Little Wolf's family as they prepare to celebrate Itse Selu, the harvest festival. As night approaches the village, the magic of anticipation fills the air. The luscious feast, Grandfather's storytelling, and the sacred corn dance weave a magical tapestry of tradition.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

The Honour Drum by Cheryl Bear and Tim Huff
ISBN/ASIN 978-1927355640 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: Written as a partnership between two friends -- an Indigenous woman and a non-Indigenous man -- The Honour Drum introduces children to the history, stories, traditions, and symbols that have been meaningful to Indigenous people from the distant past right up to today. Its aim is to foster understanding, empathy, and appreciation, and to spark meaningful conversations with your children.

Assignments_T1: Come and Learn with Me (Partial Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Come and Learn with Me by Sheyenne Jumbo & Mindy Willett
ISBN/ASIN 9781897252574 

➜ RATIONALE: Nine-year-old Sheyenne Jumbo is a Dene girl who lives in Sambaa K'e (Trout Lake), Northwest Territories. In this book, she introduces young readers like herself to her community and traditions. The conversational tone of the book is complemented by the photographs of Sheyenne's family, her day-to-day life, and the beautiful landscape surrounding Trout Lake.

Resource Assignment: 001.001.000*Thirteen Moons on Turtle's Back: A Native American Year of Moons->History: Grade 1 (Canada)
Assignments_T1: Thirteen Moons on Turtle's Back: A Native American Year of Moons (Partial Term)
Assignments_T2: Thirteen Moons on Turtle's Back: A Native American Year of Moons (Partial Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Thirteen Moons on Turtle's Back: A Native American Year of Moons by Joseph Bruchac & Jonathan London
ISBN/ASIN 978-0698115842 

➜ RATIONALE: In Native American legend, the thirteen scales on a turtle's back symbolize the annual thirteen cycles of the moon and the seasonal changes each one brings. The thirteen poems in this book -- one for each moon of the year, and each from a different indigenous group -- celebrate the natural world and weave together traditional knowledge and folklore. Each poem is illustrated by a beautiful painting.

Maple Moon by Connie Brummel Crook
ISBN/ASIN 978-0773760981 

➜ RATIONALE: In Maple Moon, Connie Brummel Crook borrows from traditional folk tales to create an enchanting fictional account of how maple syrup might have been discovered. The protagonist, a young Mississauga boy named Rides the Wind, learns of the sweet water because his physical limitations prevent him from joining a hunt; yet, it is this discovery that helps his community survive the winter. Illustrated by beautiful paintings, this book teaches children that strength can come in many forms.

On the Trapline by David A. Robertson
ISBN/ASIN 978-0735266681 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: On the Trapline is an award-winning picture book, which tells the gentle story of a boy accompanying his grandfather on a trip back to his childhood home where he and his family lived off the land.

Resource Assignment: 001.001.000*Where Do You Think You're Going, Christopher Columbus?->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T1: Where Do You Think You're Going, Christopher Columbus?
Resource_Information_Text:
Where Do You Think You're Going, Christopher Columbus? by Jean Fritz
ISBN/ASIN 978-0698115804 

➜ RATIONALE: This engaging biography introduces students to the life of Christopher Columbus. The author tells about Columbus's passion for sailing, the ideas that captivated him, and the voyage that brought him to the Americas instead of the Indies. This book also talks about Columbus's life after his initial voyage and how he paved the way for future exploration even though he never realized he had landed in a New World unknown to the Europeans.

The Discovery of the Americas by Betsy & Giulio Maestro
ISBN/ASIN 0688115128 

➜ RATIONALE: From the crossing of the Bering Land Bridge over thousands of years ago to the arrival of the Europeans, this picture book paints the early discoveries of America in grand strokes. It is used as a spine to complement the other books that talk about specific people and events.

America: Our Stories (Vol. 1) by Lorene Lambert
ISBN/ASIN 978-1616346263 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This book provides a bird's eye view of American history and brings early American history to life through masterful storytelling, photographs, and reproductions of historical paintings.

Resource Assignment: 001.003.000*Moses: When Harriet Tubman Led Her People to Freedom->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T1: Moses: When Harriet Tubman Led Her People to Freedom (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Moses: When Harriet Tubman Led Her People to Freedom by Carole Boston Weatherford
ISBN/ASIN 978-0786851751 
Alternate Formats: Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This beautifully illustrated book shows the fear, the determination, and the reliance upon God demonstrated by one of the most famous conductors on the Underground Railroad.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

Resource Assignment: 001.002.000*Liberty!: How the Revolutionary War Began->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T1: Liberty!: How the Revolutionary War Began (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Liberty!: How the Revolutionary War Began by Lucille Recht Penner
ISBN/ASIN 978-0375822001 

➜ RATIONALE: This book is a great introduction for younger students about the events leading up to the Revolutionary War. With great illustrations and engaging text, students will learn about the causes of the war and the reactions of the colonists to the heavy taxes imposed by England.  Students will read about key moments such as the Boston Tea Party, the Battle of Bunker Hill, and the writing of the Declaration of Independence.

Resource Assignment: 001.004.000*At Ellis Island: A History in Many Voices->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T1: At Ellis Island: A History in Many Voices
Resource_Information_Text:
At Ellis Island: A History in Many Voices by Louise Peacock
ISBN/ASIN 978-0689830266 

➜ RATIONALE: This picture book is written in the voice of Sera, an Armenian girl from the early 1900s who is traveling to America in the early 1900s to meet her father at Ellis Island. Other vignettes throughout the book give descriptions of the journey of immigrants from various countries who left their homeland to find a new life in America.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

Leah's Pony by Elizabeth Friedrich
ISBN/ASIN 978-1563978289 

➜ RATIONALE: This story about a family during the Dust Bowl of the 1930s captures the hardships of life and the selfless act of one girl who strives to save the family farm.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

Resource Assignment: 001.004.000*The Poppy Lady: Moina Belle Michael and Her Tribute to Veterans->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T1: The Poppy Lady: Moina Belle Michael and Her Tribute to Veterans
Resource_Information_Text:
The Poppy Lady: Moina Belle Michael and Her Tribute to Veterans by Barbara Walsh
ISBN/ASIN 978-1590787540 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This picture book tells the story of Moina Belle Michael, a schoolteacher from Georgia, who established the red poppy as the enduring symbol to remember the veterans. The historical events leading up to World War I and their effect on the lives of men and women are introduced in an age-appropriate way.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

Resource Assignment: 001.002.000*Guns for General Washington: A Story of the American Revolution->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T1: Guns for General Washington: A Story of the American Revolution (Partial Term)
Assignments_T2: Guns for General Washington: A Story of the American Revolution (Full Term)
Assignments_T3: Guns for General Washington: A Story of the American Revolution (Partial Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Guns for General Washington: A Story of the American Revolution by Seymour Reit
ISBN/ASIN 978-0152164355 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: Filled with adventure, suspense, and historical detail, this book is based on the true story of Will Knox, a nineteen-year-old young man who transported 183 cannons from New York’s Fort Ticonderoga to Boston—in the dead of winter—to help George Washington win an important battle. This story of courage and bravery brings to life one of the most crucial yet overlooked events of the American Revolution.

People of the Breaking Day by Marcia Sewall
ISBN/ASIN 978-0689816840 

➜ RATIONALE: Marcia Sewall recreates the world of the Wampanoags, the People of the Breaking Day. In a voice that evokes the pride and natural poetry of these native people and in paintings glowing with life and light, the distinguished author-illustrator presents another view of an important time in American history, a time before the meeting of two very different cultures.

The Lost Colony of Roanoke by Jean Fritz
ISBN/ASIN 978-0399240270 

➜ RATIONALE: The Lost Colony of Roanoke is one of the most puzzling mysteries in America's history. In 1587, 115 colonists sailed to the new world, eager to build the brand new Cittie of Raleigh, only to disappear practically without a trace. This book tells about one of the first colonies of America and the mystery that surrounds it.

Assignments_T2: Stories of America vol.2 (Full Term - Ch.1-6)
Assignments_T3: Stories of America vol.2 (Full Term - Ch.7-14)
Resource_Information_Text:
Stories of America vol.2 by Charles Morris, Sonya Shafer
ISBN/ASIN 9781616341695 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This series, originally written in 1901 by Charles Morris, has been lightly edited and updated for today's readers.

Resource Assignment: 002.004.000*The Great Migration: An American Story->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T2: The Great Migration: An American Story
Resource_Information_Text:
The Great Migration: An American Story by Jacob Lawrence
ISBN/ASIN 978-0064434287 

➜ RATIONALE: The plight of African Americans from the rural South to the urban North during the first half of the 20th century is captured through pictures and words.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. 
Preview first for sensitive children.

Resource Assignment: 002.004.000*Across the Blue Pacific: A World War II Story->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T2: Across the Blue Pacific: A World War II Story
Resource_Information_Text:
Across the Blue Pacific: A World War II Story by Louise Borden
ISBN/ASIN 978-0544555525 

➜ RATIONALE: This picture book about World World II is told from the perspective of a young girl whose neighbor is in the Navy and serving his country in the South Atlantic. It provides a glimpse of how young people strived to make sense of a war so far away and how they supported the soldiers who were fighting bravely.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

The Unbreakable Code by Sara Hunter
ISBN/ASIN 978-0873589178 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: RATIONALE: A grandfather tells the story of his experience as a Navajo Code Talker during World World II. A fascinating look at how the Navajo language was used to help the Allies beat the Japanese.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

ISBN/ASIN 978-1426375248  ✓REFERENCE

➜ RATIONALE: This atlas is used across the curriculum as a reference and as a text to read in some lessons. With interesting information and pictures, this is an economical reference for students.

NOTE: Optional for Grade 1. For U.S. students.
➜ May sub earlier edition. Other atlases may be used; however, map work and other lessons refer specifically to this one.

The New Americans by Betsy Maestro
ISBN/ASIN 978-0060575724 

➜ RATIONALE: The New Americans is the story of the colonists—the more than two hundred thousand new Americans— who came over from Europe and struggled to build a home for themselves in a new world. This book is used as a spine to provide context to complement the other books about specific people and events.

The Pilgrims of Plimoth by Marcia Sewall
ISBN/ASIN 978-0689808616 

➜ RATIONALE: In a text that mirrors their language and thoughts, Marcia Sewall has masterfully recreated the coming of the pilgrims to the New World, and the daily flow of their days during the first years in the colony they called Plimoth.

A Boy Called Slow by Joseph Bruchac
ISBN/ASIN 978-0698116160 
Alternate Formats: Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: A young Lakota Sioux boy comes of age and earns the name "Sitting Bull."

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

Resource Assignment: 003.004.000*Child of the Civil Rights Movement->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T3: Child of the Civil Rights Movement
Resource_Information_Text:
Child of the Civil Rights Movement by Paula Young Shelton
ISBN/ASIN 978-0385376068 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This picture book is written by the daughter of a civil rights leader. She introduces children to the civil rights movement through a child's perspective.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

Reaching for the Moon by Buzz Aldrin
ISBN/ASIN 978-0060554477 

➜ RATIONALE: Buzz Aldrin recounts his childhood and the events that led to the landing on the moon.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

Resource Assignment: 003.004.000*Fireboat: The Heroic Adventures of the John J. Harvey->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T3: Fireboat: The Heroic Adventures of the John J. Harvey
Resource_Information_Text:
Fireboat: The Heroic Adventures of the John J. Harvey by Maira Kalman
ISBN/ASIN 978-0142403624 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This picture book tells about the events of 9/11 for younger readers. A retired fireboat is called back to duty to fight fires when the Twin Towers go up in flames.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library.

Resource Assignment: 003.002.000*What Are You Figuring Now?: A Story about Benjamin Banneker->History: Grades 2-3 (U.S.)
Assignments_T3: What Are You Figuring Now?: A Story about Benjamin Banneker (Partial Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
What Are You Figuring Now?: A Story about Benjamin Banneker by Jeri Ferris
ISBN/ASIN 978-0876145210 
Alternate Formats: Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This is the wonderful story of Benjamin Banneker, a free black man born in Maryland in the 1700s. He was known for his accomplishments in science, as well as surveying Washington, D.C., and creating an almanac.

Exploration and Conquest by Betsy & Giulio Maestro
ISBN/ASIN 0688154743 

➜ RATIONALE: Christopher Columbus was not the first to discover the Americas, but his voyages led to European exploration of the New World. This book talks about the explorers and conquistadors who came to the Americas and how this affected the lives of those already living in this land.

Resource Assignment: 001.004.000*The Great Adventure: An Illustrated History of Canada for Young Canadians->Canadian History: Grades 2-4
Assignments_T1: The Great Adventure: An Illustrated History of Canada for Young Canadians (Selections)
Assignments_T2: The Great Adventure: An Illustrated History of Canada for Young Canadians (Selections)
Assignments_T3: The Great Adventure: An Illustrated History of Canada for Young Canadians (Selections)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Great Adventure: An Illustrated History of Canada for Young Canadians by D.J. Dickie
Alternate Formats: Ebook

Remembering John McCrae by Linda Granfield
ISBN/ASIN 978-0439935609 

➜ RATIONALE: Explore Canada in the early 20th century as we follow doctor and poet John McCrae from his childhood home in Guelph to the battlefields of WWI. This engaging biography introduces students to Canada at the turn of the century and Canada’s contributions to WWI.

Resource Assignment: 001.002.000*The Kids Book of Canadian History->Canadian History: Grades 2-4
Assignments_T1: The Kids Book of Canadian History (Full Term)
Assignments_T2: The Kids Book of Canadian History (Full Term)
Assignments_T3: The Kids Book of Canadian History (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Kids Book of Canadian History by Carlotta Hacker
ISBN/ASIN 978-1554533282 

➜ RATIONALE: This book brings Canada's history to life with engaging illustrations, helpful maps, and a narrative that keeps the complex events of our nation's past straightforward enough for even the youngest historians.

Resource Assignment: 001.002.000*The Spirit of Canada: Canada's Story in Legends, Fiction, Poems, and Songs->Canadian History: Grades 2-4
Assignments_T1: The Spirit of Canada: Canada's Story in Legends, Fiction, Poems, and Songs (Selections)
Shared_RollUp_Rotation 2:
Canadian History: Grades 2-4
Tall Tales/ Fables
Resource_Information_Text:
The Spirit of Canada: Canada's Story in Legends, Fiction, Poems, and Songs by Barbara Hehner
ISBN/ASIN 978-1894121149 

➜ RATIONALE: Organized thematically, this beautiful anthology encompasses a wide variety of voices and stories that reflect Canada's past and present. It is an excellent accompaniment to Canadian history and literature, as it contains many different genres: poems, songs, letters, legends, stories, folk tales, historical accounts, and more.

NOTE: Canadian students should purchase this book and NOT American Tall Tales for the Tall Tales/Fables course.

Resource Assignment: 001.002.000*The Kids Book of Aboriginal Peoples in Canada->Canadian History: Grades 2-4
Assignments_T1: The Kids Book of Aboriginal Peoples in Canada (Full Term)
Assignments_T2: The Kids Book of Aboriginal Peoples in Canada (Full Term)
Assignments_T3: The Kids Book of Aboriginal Peoples in Canada (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
The Kids Book of Aboriginal Peoples in Canada by Diane Silvey
ISBN/ASIN 978-1550749984 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This well-researched and beautifully illustrated book introduces children to traditions and cultures of seven Indigenous groups at the time just before first contact with Europeans. The detailed illustrations are based on current research, museum artifacts, historical paintings, and written descriptions from the time, and they provide a lively and engaging representation of the past.

Famous Canadian Stories by George E. Tait ✓SAVE
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: It is an engaging narrative that tells about the events and people that have shaped Canada, beginning with the explorers searching for a Northwest passage.

Fatty Legs by Christy Jordan-Fenton and Margaret Olemaun Pokiak-Fenton
ISBN/ASIN 978-1773213507 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: Accompanied by personal photos and emotional illustrations, Margaret-Olemaun Pokiak-Fenton shares her experiences of attending residential school in Canada’s North in the 1940s. This book gives students an honest and age-appropriate introduction to a dark chapter of Canada’s history. Students will follow Olemaun, an 8 year-old who desperately wants to learn to read, as she travels to residential school and discovers everything is not as she hoped.

Tuk and the Whale by Raquel Rivera
ISBN/ASIN 978-0888998910 

➜ RATIONALE: Tuk and the Whale is a work of historical fiction, which imagines a seventeenth-century encounter between the Inuit of Baffin Island and a beleaguered European whaling ship that strayed from its expected route. Wary of each other, unable to communicate, yet united in a common purpose - the whale hunt - these two groups interacted for the first time to form a tentative partnership and begin to learn from each other. Since the story is told from the perspective of Tuk, a young Inuit boy, it is engaging for young readers, and it presents a vivid depiction of a way of life that has now largely vanished.

NOTE: This is good as an independent read for Grade 4 or confident readers.

Shared_RollUp_Rotation 1:
Canadian History: Grades 2-4
Canadian History: Grades 5-6
Resource_Information_Text:
Champlain by Christopher Moore
ISBN/ASIN 978-0887766572 

➜ RATIONALE: In this remarkable book, illustrated entirely with paintings, archival maps, and original artifacts, the author brings to life this complex man and, through him, creates a portrait of Canada in its earliest days.

Resource Assignment: 003.004.000*Breaking Free: The Story of William Kurelek->Canadian History: Grades 2-4
Assignments_T3: Breaking Free: The Story of William Kurelek
Resource_Information_Text:
Breaking Free: The Story of William Kurelek by May Ebbitt Cutler
ISBN/ASIN 978-0887766176 

➜ RATIONALE: Born in the Prairies in 1927, William Kurelek’s art exemplifies the joy and challenges of Canada in the mid-1900s. In this biography, students will follow Kurelek from Alberta to England to Ontario as they learn about agriculture, immigration, and the life of Christians in Canada. The landscape of Canada in the 1900s is vividly depicted through Kurelek's art and illustrations.

NOTE: Only available used, but you should be able to find used copies or find it at your local library.

The Red Sash by Jean E. Pendziwol
ISBN/ASIN 978-0888995896 

➜ RATIONALE: The Red Sash portrays what life was like for a Metis family living near the fur-trading post of Fort William on Lake Superior at the dawn of the nineteenth century. The story takes place during Rendezvous, when voyageurs returned to Fort William with the furs they received in trade with Indigenous people, and where they meet merchants from the North West Company. Vivid and historically accurate illustrations give an authentic picture of life at this busy fur-trading post.

Shared_RollUp_Rotation 1:
U.S. History: Grades 4-6
Canadian History: Grades 5-6
Resource_Information_Text:
Turtle Island by Yellowhorn & Lowinger
ISBN/ASIN 978-1554519439 

➜ RATIONALE: Based on archeological finds and scientific research, we now have a clearer picture of how the Indigenous people lived in the Americas. Using that knowledge, the authors take the reader back thousands of years ago to imagine moments in time. The importance of story-telling among the Native peoples is always present to shed light on how they explained their world. The end of the book takes us to modern times when the story of the Native peoples is both tragic and hopeful.

Shared_RollUp_Rotation 3:
U.S. History: Grades 4-6
U.S. History: Grades 7-8
Resource_Information_Text:
America Grows Up by Gerald W. Johnson
ISBN/ASIN 978-1-63334-101-2 

➜ RATIONALE: This trilogy gives an overview of American History from Columbus through the 1960s. Johnson's ability to zoom out and articulate the overarching ideas of the time and the significance of events is an important contribution to the study of history.

Fighting for the Forest: How FDR's Civilian Conservation Corps Helped Save America by P. O'Connell Pearson
ISBN/ASIN 978-1534429338 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This book tells the story of the Civilian Conservation Corps, created during the Depression era to bring jobs to many men and preserve our national parks. Through the personal journeys of young men, students get a better understanding of that era of history and think about the government's role in the economy and job creation.

America: Our Stories (Vol. 1) by Lorene Lambert
ISBN/ASIN 978-1616346263 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This book provides a bird's eye view of American history and brings early American history to life through masterful storytelling, photographs, and reproductions of historical paintings.

Historical Atlas of the World 6th Ed. by Rand McNally
ISBN/ASIN 978-0528026553  ✓REFERENCE

➜ RATIONALE: Presents important periods and turning points in 5,000 years of history. Thematic maps include literacy, languages, religions, and more. Used across curriculum.

America: Our Stories (Vol. 1) by Lorene Lambert
ISBN/ASIN 978-1616346263 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This book provides a bird's eye view of American history and brings early American history to life through masterful storytelling, photographs, and reproductions of historical paintings.

Resource Assignment: 002.001.000*The Adventurous Life of Myles Standish->U.S. History: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T2: The Adventurous Life of Myles Standish
Assignments_T3: The Adventurous Life of Myles Standish
Resource_Information_Text:
The Adventurous Life of Myles Standish by Cheryl Harness
ISBN/ASIN 978-1426302848 

➜ RATIONALE: This engaging book about the life of Myles Standish, an English soldier, is a great way to study so many topics that are connected to him—the English monarchy, the Reformation, the Pilgrims, the Mayflower, Plymouth Colony, and Native Americans.  This book also has wonderful illustrations, detailed maps, and timelines that show students what else was happening around the world at this time.

Pink and Say by Patricia Polacco
ISBN/ASIN 978-0399226717 
Alternate Formats: Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: An unlikely friendship is born when a wounded Union soldier is found and given care in
Confederate territory. But his presence puts everyone around him in danger.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

Resource Assignment: 002.004.000*Seen and Unseen: What Dorothea Lange, Toyo Miyatake, and Ansel Adams's Photographs Reveal About the Japanese American Incarceration->U.S. History: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T2: Seen and Unseen: What Dorothea Lange, Toyo Miyatake, and Ansel Adams's Photographs Reveal About the Japanese American Incarceration
Shared_RollUp_Rotation 4:
U.S. History: Grades 4-6
U.S. History: Grades 7-8
Resource_Information_Text:
Seen and Unseen: What Dorothea Lange, Toyo Miyatake, and Ansel Adams's Photographs Reveal About the Japanese American Incarceration by Elizabeth Partridge
ISBN/ASIN 978-1452165103 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: Graphic novel showing the experience and perspective of three photographers who documented the Japanese American incarceration.

Resource Assignment: 002.004.000*Hidden Figures Young Readers' Edition->U.S. History: Grades 4-6
Resource_Information_Text:
Hidden Figures Young Readers' Edition by Margot Lee Shetterly
ISBN/ASIN 978-0062662378 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This true story tells about four African American female mathematicians at NASA who were part of the space program. This story incorporates many important topics that are part of US History during this period. These topics include racial segregation, World War II, civil rights, Cold War, and the space race.

Resource Assignment: 002.002.000*A Young Patriot: The American Revolution as Experienced by One Boy->U.S. History: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T2: A Young Patriot: The American Revolution as Experienced by One Boy (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
A Young Patriot: The American Revolution as Experienced by One Boy by Jim Murphy
ISBN/ASIN 978-0395900192 

➜ RATIONALE: This book is based on the true account of Joseph Plumb Martin, a Connecticut farm boy who enlisted in the army in 1776. Students will witness first hand what life was like for a soldier during the Revolutionary War.

Coolies by Yin
ISBN/ASIN 978-0142500552 
Alternate Formats: Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This is the story of two Chinese brothers who come to California to make a better life for themselves and their families back home. They find work helping to build the Transcontinental Railroad and find that life in America is much more difficult than they thought it would be.

NOTE: Used briefly. You may wish to check out from the library. Available on Learning Ally with Audio.

Resource Assignment: 003.002.000*A Free Woman on God's Earth->U.S. History: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T3: A Free Woman on God's Earth (Partial Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
A Free Woman on God's Earth by Jana Laiz & Ann-Elizabeth Barnes
ISBN/ASIN 978-0981491028 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This is the story of Elizabeth "Mumbet" Freeman, the enslaved African woman who had the courage and conviction to speak what was in her heart, suing for her freedom in a Massachusetts court of law.

America Is Under Attack by Don Brown
ISBN/ASIN 978-1250044150 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This picture book recounts the events of 9/11 and highlights a few heroes who were not afraid to go into harm's way.

Resource Assignment: 001.001.000*A Castle with Many Rooms->World History: Grades 4-6
Resource_Information_Text:
A Castle with Many Rooms by Lorene Lambert
ISBN/ASIN 978-1616343835 

➜ RATIONALE: This history spine covers important events and influential people from the Middle Ages. Students will get a feel for what life was like then in Europe, Africa, the Americas, the Middle East and Asia.

Thrown to the Wind by Amanda M. Cetas
ISBN/ASIN 978-1733203456 
Alternate Formats: Ebook, Audiobook

➜ RATIONALE: This novel, which is based on a true story, takes students back to France in the late 1700s to learn about a family who flees France to avoid arrest for religious heresy. The author recreates the sights, sounds, and emotions of an era, which helps students to feel as if they are experiencing events alongside historical figures. Students will learn about France, Amsterdam, and New Netherland as they journey along with nine-year-old Etienne as he faces robbers, pirates, two perilous sea voyages, and an uncertain future to chart a new destiny.

Resource Assignment: 002.001.000*Fine Print: A Story about Johann Gutenberg->World History: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T2: Fine Print: A Story about Johann Gutenberg
Resource_Information_Text:
Fine Print: A Story about Johann Gutenberg by Joann Johansen Burch
ISBN/ASIN 978-0876145654 

➜ RATIONALE: This is the story of the man who invented the printing press and gave the world the gift of books. This book tells the journey of a boy from a small town in Germany who loved books to a man who never gave up his dream to make the mass spread of literature a reality. His invention had a direct impact on the development of the Renaissance and Reformation.

Resource Assignment: 002.002.000*Robert Boyle: Trailblazer of Science->World History: Grades 4-6
Assignments_T2: Robert Boyle: Trailblazer of Science (Partial Term)
Assignments_T3: Robert Boyle: Trailblazer of Science (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Robert Boyle: Trailblazer of Science by John Tiner
ISBN/ASIN 978-0880621557 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: Robert Boyle was one of the most prolific figures in the Scientific Revolution and the leading scientist of his day. He was born in Ireland in 1627 to one of the wealthiest families in Britain. This book sets the life of Boyle in the context of the tumultuous events of the 17th century, including the Irish Rebellion, the execution of Charles I, and the Great Fire of London. Students will learn about a scientist who believed that science and faith were not mutually exclusive, but that the study of the world illuminated the glory of God.

Resource_Information_Text:
Historical Atlas of the World 6th Ed. by Rand McNally
ISBN/ASIN 978-0528026553  ✓REFERENCE

➜ RATIONALE: Presents important periods and turning points in 5,000 years of history. Thematic maps include literacy, languages, religions, and more. Used across curriculum.

Lion in the Gateway by Mary Renault
ISBN/ASIN 978-0988510616 

➜ RATIONALE: Mary Renault, a master storyteller known for her novels about ancient Greece, weaves historical facts with vivid storytelling in this book that brings the people of ancient Greece to life. This book begins with the historical roots of the people of Ancient Greece and tells how they came to love their freedom more than anything else. The remainder of the book retells iconic events like The Battle of Marathon, the stand of the Spartans at Thermopylae, and the naval triumph at Salamis. Students will learn about historical figures such as Themistocles, Leonidas, and Xerxes, as well as the ordinary Greek citizens who valued courage and resilience. 

➜ May sub Story of Civilization (ch.13-22) by Philip Campbell if you already own it. However, lesson plans will not be provided for that book.

Pyramid by David Macaulay
ISBN/ASIN 978-0395321218 

➜ RATIONALE: This book gives students an opportunity to learn more about ancient Egyptian civilization, history, and architecture as the author illustrates and recounts detail by detail, how the great pharaohs' burial places were conceived and constructed.

Resource Assignment: 002.002.002*Victory on the Walls: A Story of Nehemiah->Ancient History: Grades 5-6
Assignments_T2: Victory on the Walls: A Story of Nehemiah (Partial Term)
Assignments_T3: Victory on the Walls: A Story of Nehemiah (Full Term)
Resource_Information_Text:
Victory on the Walls: A Story of Nehemiah by Frieda Clark Hyman
ISBN/ASIN 978-1883937966 
Alternate Formats: Ebook

➜ RATIONALE: This historical novel is told through the eyes of Nehemiah's nephew and illustrates a turning point in Jewish history--when King Artaxerxes allows his cupbearer, Nehemiah, to return to Jerusalem to rebuild the walls.The reader makes fascinating connections between events in the Bible and other historical events that happened simultaneously. Students might assume that Bible history took place in a vacuum, but this book will help them understand how events that took place in nearby countries affected God's people.

Shared_RollUp_Rotation 1:
U.S. History: Grades 4-6
Canadian History: Grades 5-6
Resource_Information_Text:
Turtle Island by Yellowhorn & Lowinger
ISBN/ASIN 978-1554519439 

➜ RATIONALE: Based on archeological finds and scientific research, we now have a clearer picture of how the Indigenous people lived in the Americas. Using that knowledge, the authors take the reader back thousands of years ago to imagine moments in time. The importance of story-telling among the Native peoples is always present to shed light on how they explained their world. The end of the book takes us to modern times when the story of the Native peoples is both tragic and hopeful.

Canadian History: Grades 7-8
Shared_RollUp_Rotation 3:
Canadian History: Grades 5-6
Canadian History: Grades 7-8
Resource_Information_Text:
The Story of Canada by Janet Lunn, Christopher Moore
ISBN/ASIN 978-1895555325 

➜ RATIONALE: Canadian history is told through rich narrative, recreations of daily life, folk tales, and fascinating facts.

➜ May sub previous edition. Page numbers will differ from lesson plans.

Amo's Sapotawan by William Dumas
ISBN/ASIN 978-1553799290 

➜ RATIONALE: Amo's Sapotawan is a beautifully illustrated story of a Rocky Cree girl, Amo, and her sapotawan, which means a rite of passage, as she chooses the path for her life. This book combines an engaging story with sidebars that explain traditional practices and cultural information in greater detail; the end result is a richly historical integration of narrative and nonfiction, where Amo's personal story teaches readers about Indigenous life in the seventeenth century. Yet, this is also a universal story of how a young teenager, with support from her community, works to discover where her skills and gifts lie.
